Malik to Head, no run gone, is it? Skips down the track too early and Malik fires it in way outside off. Turns sharply too, so Rizwan had to move left to collect it before he could complete the stumping. Gives Head enough time to drag his foot back into the crease
Malik to Head, 2 runs shortish outside off, slapped to the right of sweeper cover

Fullish on off stump and he plays a defensive push into the off side, not too far from the finish of Junaid's follow-through, but both he and Head take off immediately to ensure they complete the quick single with ease. Only two Pakistan bowlers have conceded 100 runs in an ODI.

But look away from the scorecard if you're a bowler. Hasan became the second Pakistan bowler to concede 100 in ODIs, Amir and Junaid were also attacked by Warner. Wahab worked up some serious pace and briefly held his own. Right then, Pakistan need to nail the highest chase on Australian soil if they're to win this. KK will be back with you for the start of the second innings.

5.50pm David Warner ran up his sixth ODI century in his last 11 innings to underpin Australia's hefty total. Travis Head, who hit his maiden ODI century, partnered him at the top in a 284-run stand, the highest for any wicket for Australia in this format. When Warner shifted through the gears, 400 seemed likely, but a clatter of wickets in the death overs as restricted Australia to 369.

Cummins to Babar Azam, 1 run just short of a good length and outside off, slower one, angled down to third man
Cummins to Umar Akmal, 1 run length and outside off, opens the face, and guides past backward point to third man
Cummins to Babar Azam, 1 wide short and down leg, ducks under it. Wide called
Cummins to Babar Azam, no run Babar shuffles across off, meets a hip-high short ball on middle, not sure if he inside-edged it onto the thigh
Cummins to Babar Azam, 2 runs short of a length and outside off, swatted away to the left of deep midwicket
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, no run back of a length, skids on, beats the batsman's attempt to flick to leg and raps the thigh
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, no run length ball on middle, slower, Umar eyes a leg-side pick up and is hit on the box
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, 1 run back of a length and outside off, stands up tall and punches to sweeper cover
Faulkner to Babar Azam, no run
Faulkner to Babar Azam, 1 run short of a length and outside off, leans back and cuts to the right of third man
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs full on middle and leg, picked up and flicked in the air over backward square leg
Cummins to Babar Azam, 2 runs length ball outside off, chipped in the air straight down the ground
Cummins to Babar Azam, no run just short of a good length on off, hops and chops to point
Cummins to Babar Azam, 1 run length and outside off, deftly run down to third man
Cummins to Umar Akmal, no run high bouncer outside off, the batsman drops his wrists on it. Not a wide. Cummins gets away
Cummins to Umar Akmal, 1 run back of a length and outside off, 143ks, guided down to third man for one more
Cummins to Babar Azam, no run short on middle, 146ks, hustles the batsman for pace. More of a short-arm flap than a short-arm pull. The ball goes only as far as midwicket
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, 1 run back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away into the midwicket region
Faulkner to Babar Azam, no run slower ball, full on off stump, driven with a lot of power but hit straight to mid-off
Faulkner to Babar Azam, FOUR runs shortish, too much width, slapped away to the point boundary and Babar moves into the 90s

Faulkner to Babar Azam, FOUR runs short again, down the leg side this time, and that's terrible bowling with fine leg in the circle. Whip-pulled away to the left of the fielder and it races for another four

Faulkner to Babar Azam, FOUR runs loopy slower ball wide of off stump, and that's superbly played by Babar, just reaches out and meets it with an open bat face to steer it to the right of backward point
Faulkner to Babar Azam, 1 run back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and pushes into the point region to move to 99
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, 1 wide length ball, wide of off, well wide in fact. Reaches out to drive and plays and misses. Called wide, and on replay it's clear it was wide of the tramline

Hazlewood to Babar Azam, 1 run there's the hundred, it's been a superb innings so far. Back of a length on off stump, and he tucks it quietly through square leg to pick up one. Not too much of a celebration. Takes his helmet off, raises his bat to the crowd, hugs his cousin at the other end, and gets back to business
Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, 1 run back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to play that to mid-on
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run fullish, and he gets this to swing away from a fifth-stump line to beat Babar's attempted on-the-up drive
Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, 1 wide short, very wide outside off. Akmal reaches out to cut but can't connect
Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, no run fullish outside off, defended to point
Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, 1 run back of a length on leg stump, worked away to deep midwicket
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, no run back of a length, slanted across the right-hander. Akmal lets it come on and dabs to backward point

Faulkner to Umar Akmal, no run back of a length on off stump, came back in slightly to cramp Akmal. Wanted to punch that through the covers, in the end he can only jam down his bat and squeeze it to backward point
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, 1 run length ball on middle stump, slogged away, on the bounce, to deep midwicket
Faulkner to Rizwan, 1 run back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to stab it down to third man

Faulkner to Umar Akmal, 1 run full on off stump, and that's dropped. Long-on was back, Akmal decided to take him on, and didn't get as much pace onto the bat as he'd have liked. Scooped it up, and Handscomb, running to his left and reaching overhead, got both hands to the ball but couldn't hold on
Faulkner to Rizwan, 1 run on the pads, clipped away through square leg
Hazlewood to Rizwan, 1 wide full, angling down leg. Rizwan can't connect with the flick
Hazlewood to Rizwan, 1 run fullish, angling into off stump, driven firmly, beats cover diving to his right, but can't beat Warner, running to his left from mid-on
Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs short, angling into the body, and that's excellent, swivelled to pull it from just in front of his chest, finds the gap between deep midwicket and long leg

Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, no run ooh, what a follow-up. Back of a length, angling into off stump, straightening late. Opens up Akmal and beats his outside edge as he looks to defend, feet rooted to the spot

Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, 2 runs fullish on off stump, and that's a safe shot now that mid-on and midwicket are in the circle. Doesn't really middle this slog, but gets it safely over the gap between the two fielders

Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs shot! That's a length ball angling into off stump, nothing too wrong with it, considering the movement he's getting. Brings his bottom hand into play and whips it wristily over the gap to mid-on's left
Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, no run length ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler, who sees Akmal out of his crease and fires a throw that narrowly misses off stump
Cummins to Rizwan, 1 run short, rising ball angling into the body. Jumps to ride the bounce and knocks it down into the leg side with soft hands
Cummins to Umar Akmal, no run slower ball outside off, Akmal slogs and misses

Cummins to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs full, a little wider outside off, Akmal slices under the ball, halfway deliberately, to send it soaring into the air over the point region and it lands in the big gap to the right of third man
Cummins to Umar Akmal, 1 run short outside off, looks like another slower ball. Akmal waits this time before dabbing it down to third man

Cummins to Rizwan, 2 runs bouncer, difficult one for Rizwan to negotiate, he has to hook from over his right shoulder. Top-edges and it loops over the keeper and lands in the gap to the right of long leg

Cummins to Rizwan, OUT short outside off, and that's timed too well for Rizwan's liking. Goes for the slash, ends up slicing under the ball, and does it carry to Starc diving forward from third man? He himself isn't sure. They're checking upstairs now... Soft signal is out. Looks like he's taken it cleanly. Yup, out, and is that it for Pakistan?
Hazlewood to Amir, no run length ball slanting away from off stump. Amir looks for the drive through cover, doesn't get forward quickly enough and he's comfortably beaten
Hazlewood to Amir, no run this one's shorter, a little wider. Amir throws his bat at it but doesn't move his feet at all. Beaten again
Hazlewood to Amir, 1 run shortish outside off, steered down to third man
Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, 1 run back of a length outside off, sliced to third man
Hazlewood to Amir, 1 run length ball close to off stump, driven through point with a slightly open face
Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, 1 run back of a length outside off, lets it come on and dabs to third man
Cummins to Umar Akmal, no run slower bouncer outside off, Akmal can't connect with the hook
Cummins to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs back of a length outside off, another slower ball. This time Akmal holds his shape nicely, and swats it away to the wide long-on boundary

Cummins to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs looks for the wide yorker, ends up bowling a fast, low, wide full-toss. Akmal uses the pace well, slices under it with an open face to send it screaming to the left of third man
Cummins to Umar Akmal, no run This time he gets the wide yorker more or less on target. Akmal looks to reach out and squeeze it away, can't connect
Cummins to Umar Akmal, 1 run slower full-toss on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
Cummins to Amir, no run back of a length on middle stump, defended to cover
Hazlewood to Umar Akmal, 1 run back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover

Hazlewood to Amir, 2 runs fullish on off stump, clears his front leg to slog, ends up dragging it along the ground to mid-on. An inaccurate shy at the bowler's end - from Cummins - gifts an overthrow, though Amir was out if he'd hit
Hazlewood to Amir, no run slower length ball on middle and off. Looks to make room to slap through the off side, can't get it past cover
Hazlewood to Amir, FOUR runs now he middles one. Fullish on middle stump, makes himself room again and lifts it over extra-cover
Hazlewood to Amir, no run full on leg stump, driven with a lot of effort but straight to mid-on

Hazlewood to Amir, SIX runs shortish now, looks like another slower ball. Amir clears his front leg early, but then spots the change-up and holds his shape, and that allows him to time his swat over midwicket as sweetly as possible

Cummins to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs slower ball, full and wide, and Akmal smacks it over mid-off. Picked his spot, and got exactly the delivery he needed. Cleared his front leg to make himself extra swinging room

Cummins to Umar Akmal, no run yorker on off stump, jabbed away to backward point and he wants a single. He's nearly halfway down the pitch before Amir sends him back. Makes his ground safely enough in the end
Cummins to Wahab Riaz, 1 leg bye full, angling down leg. Can't connect with the flick and the ball hits him on the pad
Cummins to Amir, 1 run that's the bouncer angled across Amir, and it's well played, kept his eye on it and then helped it over the keeper and slip, down to third man
Cummins to Wahab Riaz, 1 run full on off stump, driven crisply to sweeper cover
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, 1 run slower ball, leg-stumpish. Clears his front leg and gets down on one knee to swipe it through backward square leg
Faulkner to Amir, no run another slower ball, wide outside the left-hander's off stump. Amir slogs and misses
Faulkner to Amir, 2 runs loopy slower ball on middle stump, Amir makes room and slices it away to the left of short third man
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, 1 wide slower ball wide of off, Wahab slashes and misses. Shamsuddin signals wide
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, 2 runs another wide slower ball, fuller this time, slashed to the left of deep point
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, 1 run full on off stump, clears his front leg to flat-bat to long-off
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run middle-stump yorker, jams his bat down to dig it out
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run full outside off. Wahab goes for the flashing drive, and can't connect
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run low full-toss, almost hits the base of off stump on the full after Wahab clears his front leg and misses an ambitious drive
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run very full outside off, Wahab plays and misses
Starc to Wahab Riaz, 1 run full outside off, sliced in the air, on the bounce, to the right of third man
Starc to Hasan Ali, 2 runs full-toss outside off, and Hasan is off the mark with a nervy push that he edges. Bounces as it approaches Wade, and it hits his pad and runs away towards third man
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, 1 run slower ball at the batsman's legs. Gets down on one knee and slogs it away through square leg
Faulkner to Hasan Ali, 1 run length ball on middle stump, clipped to short fine leg
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, 1 run short on off stump, pulled in the air, one-bounce, to the right of long-on
Faulkner to Hasan Ali, 1 run loopy slower ball, full on off stump, pushed to mid-off
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, 1 run another slower ball, another full-blooded Wahab swipe, rolls along down to backward square leg
Faulkner to Hasan Ali, 1 run another slower ball. This time Hasan slogs, slices it high in the air, drops into the vacant mid-off region
Starc to Hasan Ali, 1 leg bye full, slanting down leg. Misses the flick and it ricochets into the leg side off the pad
Starc to Wahab Riaz, 2 runs full on middle stump, Wahab clears his front leg and miscues a pick-up shot over mid-on. Just about clears the fielder
Starc to Wahab Riaz, FOUR runs fullish on off stump, clears his front leg again, and this time meets it with a straight bat, shovels it back over the bowler's head
Starc to Wahab Riaz, 1 run full-toss outside off, Wahab slices it over cover point, and Zampa, running in from the boundary and diving forward, gets both hands to it and spills it.
Starc to Hasan Ali, 1 run what is happening here? Full toss on off stump, looks to push towards mid-on and gets a leading edge that loops over short cover, to his left. Starc is furious
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run full outside off, Wahab has a big swing at it, and misses
Zampa to Hasan Ali, no run short ball, slides on with the angle to hit the batsman's thigh after he misses the pull
Zampa to Hasan Ali, SIX runs flighted outside off, Hasan goes for the slog-sweep and clears Maxwell, jumping to his right at the deep midwicket boundary
Zampa to Hasan Ali, 1 run down the track now, chips it on the bounce to sweeper cover
Zampa to Wahab Riaz, no run dangled up slow outside off, Wahab is too early into his slog-sweep, can't connect
Zampa to Wahab Riaz, 1 run this time it's too full for the slog-sweep, bottom-edges it to short fine leg

10.03pm Australia have wrapped up a 4-1 series win. A record opening stand from Warner and Head set it up for them, and 370 was always going to be a hugely difficult ask for Pakistan. Credit to them for fighting hard and staying in contention, just about, for most of their innings.
Anyway, Deiva and I will go off and have some well-earned rest. Until next time, bye!

10.20pm Phew. That's it from us, after a looong day at the Adelaide Oval. A triumphant end to the summer for Australia after a rocky beginning against South Africa. Hope you've enjoyed our coverage of the series, and you can pop over to the India-England T20 ball-by-ball if you so wish.
Australia won by 57 runs
Player of the match is David Warner, AUS
